[[File:Sentinel Squad O*N*E Vol 1 1 Textless.jpg|left|thumb]]
===Creation===
The '''Office of National Emergency''' or '''O*N*E''' was created by the [[Presidents of the United States of America]] upon releasing [[Executive Order 13361]] of November 16, 2004.{{r|X-Men: The 198 Files #1|; [[Executive Order 13386]]}} The Office was headquartered at the [[Pentagon]], in [[Washington, D.C.]]{{r|Decimation: House of M - The Day After #1}}

[[Executive Order 13372]] of February 16, 2005, later established [[Sentinel Squad O*N*E (Earth-616)|Sentinel Squad O*N*E (S,S,1)]].{{r|X-Men: The 198 Files #1|; [[Executive Order 13386]]}}

...{{r|Sentinel Squad O*N*E #1}}{{r|Sentinel Squad O*N*E #2}}{{r|Sentinel Squad O*N*E #3}}{{r|Sentinel Squad O*N*E #4}}{{r|Sentinel Squad O*N*E #5}}<!-- Sentinel Squad --><!-- part of those references might be misplaced chronologically, and might fit other sections of this page --><!-- possible new title depending on the pre-M-Day activities of ONE -->

===[[M-Day]]===
Upon the [[M-Day]], an event that caused a massive depoweration of the [[Homo superior|mutant]] population, the President had the O*N*E go active.{{r|Decimation: House of M - The Day After #1}} He also released [[Executive Order 13386]] of November 2, 2005, providing all extant intelligence on the remaining mutants, compiled and evualated by the [[Commission on Superhuman Activities (Earth-616)|Commission on Superhuman Activities (C.S.A.)]] in cooperation with [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]], as well as ordering Sentinel Squad O*N*E to active duty.{{r|X-Men: The 198 Files #1|; [[Executive Order 13386]]}}

...{{r|X-Men: The 198 #2}}{{r|X-Men: The 198 #3}}{{r|X-Men: The 198 #4}}{{r|X-Men: The 198 #5}}

The [[Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters|Xavier Institute]] had [[Sentinel Squad O*N*E (Earth-616)|Sentinel Squad O*N*E]] and a number of conventional troops stationed around it. [[Valerie Cooper (Earth-616)|Valerie Cooper]], an adviser and deputy director on the program, was sent to explain their mission to the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]].{{citation}}

Known remaining mutants have been assessed on their potential threat levels by the organization. Many government officials still fear that a human-mutant conflict will escalate to massive global warfare.{{citation}}

In light of [[Demetrius Lazer (Earth-616)|General Lazer]]'s actions, Valerie Cooper was promoted to director of the organization.{{citation}}<!--

<!-- [[O*N*E Houston Station]], which was primary storage and admin of renditioned resources, was targetted by [[Steven Rogers (Earth-616)|Steve Rogers]]' [[Secret Avengers (Black Ops Unit) (Earth-616)|Secret Avengers]], constructing a false fire using various technologies, in order to infiltrate the building. O*N*E Alpha Team of the station, composed to Baum, Ms. Sung and others -->...{{r|Secret Avengers #21}}

Val Cooper's O*N*E remained a client of X-Factor under [[Alexander Summers (Earth-616)|Havok]]'s and [[Lorna Dane (Earth-616)|Polaris]]' leadership. When a community of anti-mutant terrorists (including children) sent threatening letters to the [[Presidents of the United States of America|President]], the O*N*E stepped in and brought X-Factor along. Though the terrorists almost successully set a bomb in the camp, the operation was a success.{{r|X-Factor #233}}
